thomas_late_visit.speaker: Narrator
thomas_late_visit.text: Thomas comes in late, after Elena has left. He orders mechanically, his mind clearly elsewhere. He looks exhausted - the kind of tired that sleep can't fix.

thomas_stares.speaker: Thomas
thomas_stares.text: *He stares at Elena's empty booth* She sat there again today, didn't she? Did she... did she seem okay?

player_honest.speaker: You
player_honest.text: She's been here a lot. I think she finds some peace here.

thomas_relieved.speaker: Thomas
thomas_relieved.text: Good. That's... good. *He lets out a heavy breath* She deserves peace. More than anyone I know.

player_question.speaker: Narrator
player_question.text: Do you ask him about it?

choices.text: You clearly love your sister very much.

thomas_opens.speaker: Thomas
thomas_opens.text: *He laughs bitterly* I destroyed my family for a woman who never loved me. That's what happened. Simple as that.

thomas_emotional.speaker: Thomas
thomas_emotional.text: *His voice cracks* I do. I always did. That's what makes this so... *He takes a shaky breath* I threw away the one person who truly cared about me.

thomas_story.speaker: Thomas
thomas_story.text: Elena tried to warn me about Margot. Again and again. And I called her jealous. Possessive. I said terrible things. Things no one should say to family.

thomas_the_worst.speaker: Thomas
thomas_the_worst.text: The worst part? I knew, somewhere deep down, that she was right. But admitting it meant admitting I'd made a mistake. That my marriage was a lie. I couldn't face it.

thomas_chose.speaker: Thomas
thomas_chose.text: So I chose the lie. I chose comfort over truth. And by the time the lie fell apart on its own... Elena was gone. Our parents had passed. I was alone with my pride.

thomas_regret.speaker: Thomas
thomas_regret.text: *His hands tremble* I spent two years trying to find her. Two years composing apologies I knew would never be enough. And now that I've found her...

thomas_fear.speaker: Thomas
thomas_fear.text: ...she can barely look at me. And I don't blame her. I wouldn't forgive me either. *He meets your eyes* But I have to try. I HAVE to. She's all I have left.

choices.text: Give her time. Show up consistently. Actions speak louder than apologies.
Sometimes the people we hurt the deepest are the ones who loved us most.

thomas_takes_advice.speaker: Thomas
thomas_takes_advice.text: *He nods slowly* You're right. Words are cheap. I've got a lot of time to make up for. I can wait. I can show her I've changed.

thomas_reflects.speaker: Thomas
thomas_reflects.text: *Tears well up* She did love me. More than anyone. And I repaid that love with betrayal. *He wipes his eyes* I have to make this right. Somehow.

thomas_confides_end.speaker: Thomas
thomas_confides_end.text: Thank you for listening. And for... whatever you've done for Elena. She seems different since coming here. Less hard. Maybe there's hope for us yet.

thomas_departs.speaker: Narrator
thomas_departs.text: He leaves money on the counter - far more than his meal cost - and walks out into the evening. Your dragon watches him go, then looks at you as if asking what comes next.
